p: Liver toxicity was induced in rats by the administration of freshly prepared alloxan (100 mg/kg) dissolved in distilled water intraperitoneally to induce diabetes [ 14]. Two days later, blood was drawn from each rat and glucose level measured to establish diabetes. Animals with blood glucose levels>225 mg/dl were considered to be diabetic [ 15]. Fasting blood glucose (FBG) levels were estimated by commercially available glucose kit glucometer (Roche, Mannheim, Germany). Forty rats with blood glucose >225 mg/dl were considered to be diabetic. The 40 diabetic animals were used in the study in addition to ten normal rats that were not injected with alloxan.
